reviewText: First off, if you're considering watching this movie, make sure you've already seen Pee-Wee's Big Adventure.Go ahead, I'll wait....Done? Keen.Did you really like it? I mean, REALLY like it. Because, if not, or even if it was just kinda "meh," I'd recommend that you pass on this one. If, on the other hand, you think Pee-Wee is an awesome character that works quite well as a representation of [a whole lotta stuff I'm not going to get into, because this is not the time or place], then you should definitely watch this movie for the extra facet or two we see of Pee-Wee's character in it.Though, as much as I love Pee-Wee Herman, the musical number at the end is cringe-inducing.
summary: Not as good as the first, but (believe it or not) gives Pee-Wee more complexity.

reviewText: A Simple Loving Man named Pee-Wee (Paul Reubens), who has the Unexpected Pleasure, When a Traveling Circus Team (Lead by Kris Kristifferson) but when Pee-Wee falls in love with a Circus Performer (Valeria Golino) but again, it`s gets more Complicated with his Current Girlfriend (Penelope Ann Miller).Directed by Randel Kleiser (Grease, The Blue Lagoon, Summer Lovers) made a entertaining family film for all. It`s a Sequel to Pee-Wee Big Adventure. This film feature the Longest Kiss Scene in Movie History. This Sequel becomes a Cult Classic for Pee-Wee/Paul Reubens fans. Look Close for Actor, Oscar-Winner:Bencino Del Toro as a Circus Freak. Grade:B.

reviewText: 'Big Top Pee Wee' is a must-see for two reasons - for Danny Elfman's typically exuberant score, its hurtling rhythms and circus melodies lending the film an appropriately carnivalesque atmosphere; and the art direction.  Pee Wee's home and the town it borders is almost as stylised as the worlds of Tim Burton, with its exagerrated shapes and hyper-real colours.  Pee Wee lives on his farm with a herd of animals, including Vance, the talking pig who assists him in his scientific work, the cultivation of odd, genetically modified food (e.g. plants that grow sausages).  This cohabitation with beasts scandalises his mean-spirited neighbours, who virtually ostracise him as a pervert, with the single exception of his fiancee, apple-pie schoolmarm Penelope Anne Miller, who diverts his sexual urges with the 'favourite' egg sandwiches he loathes.  One day, a storm hits the area; when Pee Wee emerges from his shelter, he is surrounded by the wreckage of a circus.  He invites its performers to stay and put on a show in spite of the locals' opposition, and falls in love with Italian acrobat, Gina.Like his first director Burton, Pee Wee mixes cartoon social satire, in which caricatures represent wider represions, with a fantasy world in which dreams and imagination can be free.  For Pee Wee, the boundaries of these worlds fail - his absent-minded indifference to the world around him is matched by a physical clumsiness that hobbles his attempts to mentally soar.'Big Top' is a far less elaborate affair that his brilliant debut, 'Pee Wee's Big Adventure' - the plot is almost insultingly simple-minded, and there are no gadget-crammed set-pieces.  As Pee Wee becomes more adult and sexual, however, his persona becomes more perverse, even grotesque, combining innocence with lechery, decency with deceit.  The circus world is vividly realised and characterised, providing an enjoyably cliched putting-on-a-show-in-a-barn energy, but even here, in an unsettling 'Freak Show' segment, Pee Wee's dark, 'abnormal' side is fetished.

reviewText: Nearly everyone gives this follow up to Big Adventure negative reviews; however, if Big Adventure had never been made, this film would have been a much larger success and certainly a fondly remembered movie.  Though not as ground-breaking and consistently funny as Pee Wee's first film, this rather slight tale about a farm, a circus, and a tree that grows cocktail weinies has several notable charms, including great sideshow ambience and several bits of Pee Wee weirdness that will appear to adult fans.  Basically, if you love Pee Wee, there's practically no way you can dislike this film.
summary: Not as bad as you remember . . .

reviewText: Granted, Big Top Pee Wee does not promise the type of guffaw humor we enjoyed in Pee-Wee's Big Adventure, but it is a really good movie.  The humor is a bit more mature.  This might be considered a weakness of the film on the surface.  It is the immaturity of the humor that we loved so much in Big Adventure.  However, having been of the target age when Big Adventure and subsequently Big Top came out, as I grew up, so did Pee-Wee.My favorite is still the opening dream-sequence in which Pee-Wee is incognito, dressed as Abraham Lincoln to avoid his inexplicably large group of post-adolescent female fans who are waiting for him outside of the venue in which he performed his trapeze act.  One fan, unaffected by the fact that a man who had been dead for almost a hundred years at that point, breathlessly asks for "Lincoln's" autograph, professing "I'm such a big fan!"  Pee-Wee's phony Lincoln beard is then ripped off and the girls shriek with delight and chase after him.This opening sequence, though not the only highlight of this campy delight, truly captures the essence of Pee-Wee humor.  It is above all bizarre.  But the uniqueness of Pee-Wee's world is its ability to transcend time, dimension, and most of all, logic.  This was true in Pee-Wee's Playhouse and Big Adventure, but I think Big Top captures this most.The common dream sequence as an opening scene to each movie sets the tone for each movie.  When comparing the two, the dream sequence that opens Big Adventure pales in comparison.  Big Top maintains the surrealistic tone of the Lincoln scene throughout the film.  The circus owner's wife, Midge Montana is just a few inches tall.  Innuendoes between her and her husband set the imagination free.  Pee-Wee's compulsively keeps lunch date records in his personal organizer, despite the fact that he has lunch at the same time with the neurotic girlfriend.  Pee-Wee's inexplicable agricultural genius made for one of the most enduring images of my childhood-the hotdog tree.  This is really funny stuff.The movie is not without its faults, of course.  Most of them are found in the somewhat schlocky romance between Pee-Wee and the female acrobat.  I also didn't care for the ending, where Pee-Wee solves the circus' financial crisis by turning all of the grumpy towns people into children.  It sort of gives off a creepy Cocoon-like feeling, which I didn't particularly appreciate as an end-note.But otherwise, I hold this movie dear.  Almost as dear as his first movie, but in movies we rarely see a sequel (of sorts) outshine the original.

reviewText: He goes to all the trouble of getting his bike back in the first movie, then there's zero mention of it in the follow-up. Instead he has a talking pig that doesn't even start talking until several minutes after it has been introduced.This movie annoys the crap out of me because it has what has to be the longest freakin' kiss in cinematic history. I'd rather watch Francis (from Big Adventure) eat a slab of ribs with no napkins than be bored to tears by sappy music as Pee-Wee rams his tongue down some chick's throat for what has to be at least two minutes.Regardless, this movie is fun just to think about what would happen if Mace Montana got into a fight with Whistler from the Blade movies. And how'd they find an actress who is 3 inches tall?! That is amazing.

reviewText: This one is not as good as Pee-Wee's big adventure, but it is a good movie. Good enough quality, and a great price.  I recommend this for any fan of Pee-Wee or for kids of all ages.  It is a good intro to Pee-Wee if you haven't seen his movies.  It does have a few PG or even PG-13 type situations and he is even caught in a love triangle, but otherwise it could pass for G rated.
summary: Great movie, almost as good as his Big Adventure

reviewText: Big Top Pee Wee is Paul Reuben's 'Pee Wee' character's second full length film. It has nowhere near the lasting power of his original Pee Wee's Big Adventure and less of its charm. Still, Big Top is a somewhat cute if also somewhat obnoxious and ultimately unengaging film.The movie stars Pee Wee living on a farm in the middle of the country in a very small and rural American town filled with old cranky folk, but gladly they have Pee Wee as the local annoying boy-man to keep them on their toes. Pee Wee works as a scientist in this one as a sort of hobby where he experiments with various mutations of edible vegatable and plants, and along with his side kick pig (forget the name) the two are met with a traveling circus who for one reason or another wants so desperately to play their circus in this rural town that they get into all sorts of trouble with the local old crankies.The movie costars Kris Kristofferson as the circus head and features a colorful yet uninvolved cast of various circus freaks (one being Benecio Del Toro as the wolf man). Pee Wee falls head over heels in love at first sight with one of the circus' acrobatic ladies, thus getting involved with her and cheating on this fiance Winnie played significantly well as this clingy psycho girlfriend by Penelope Ann Miller. She's definitely one of the roles that makes this movie more watchable.So eventually Pee Wee gets very involved with the circus as they all become good friends, has some tension with his now ex-girlfriend and new girlfriend, the beautiful italian acrobat (the name slips me, but even her performance is standard but fairly well done). They run into a climax of trouble with the old cranky locals before Pee Wee uses one of this magical vegetables that turns them all into children, thus now they want the circus in town more than anything. ... how do all these kids get to actually PAY to watch the circus? I don't know. Why would a traveling circus be willing to play in such a small town for free? Why are they so desperate to do so when it is made so obviously clear they are not wanted? Judging from the talent of freaks they could be playing all over the United States. But whatever, this movie isn't supposed to make much sense anyhow.What makes the movie work at some points is mostly Pee Wee's shananigans with his ex girlfriend and new girlfriend, and Penelope Ann Miller's performance, again, keeps your attention as she plays the cute but kinda psycho clingy girlfriend very well and is handed the best lines of the film for only a supporting actress ("I understand. You're a man. ...she's italian.) Pee Wee himself is the usual, but carries much less charm than he did in his last movie, Pee Wee's Big Adventure. He's just not as funny here, he has more serious scenes and just isn't as goofy enough to keep you interested. The pig gets annoying as well. I wish they would've done something more interesting if Pee Wee needed a sidekick besides a talking pig, maybe a bird would've worked, or a actual person. A kid brother or nephew I think would've made a MUCH BETTER idea. Or maybe keeping the ex-girlfriend Winnie in the film much longer, having her perhaps somewhat involved in the later plot and climax instead of just axing her in the middle of the movie after she breaks up with Pee Wee. Everyone else gets some good scenes that make cute light of the fact that they're circus people, and the old folgies get some good scenes as well.All in all, some stuff works. The old people can be funny, Penelope Ann Miller gets some very good scenes (she's perhaps the highlight of this movie). Pee Wee himself gets about maybe 2 or 3 (tops) funny scenes. The movie tries to hold the charm of the previous but just can't. The ending is pretty standard and shallow, and the movie becomes significantly less interesting and engaging about 45 minutes in. So if you're over 25, you'll probably fall alseep, but younger kids will get a good chuckle. If I had to give this a letter grade it would probably be a C.
summary: Cute but Ultimately Stupid and Pointless

reviewText: paul reubens character was one of the greatest comedic events of our time.. From the early variety show, to the playhouse, to the big adventure - pee wee could not lose.. I remember seeing big top pee wee in the theatre - and feeling very dissapointed with a movie that was just not very fun or interesting.. Whereas 'pee wee's big adventure' explored more of pee wees quirkiness (remember the scene with the tape in the bathroom) 'big top pee wee' tried to take the character move him to a different setting and make a sort of romantic comedy.. This is probably where it all falls apart.. pee wee should not be a romantic figure - he is the opposite.. he is best when he remains a sort of neuter or man child.. the second romance enters the picture.. pee wee loses all of his charm and comedy.. there are a few funny moments in big top pee wee but on the whole it falls flat.

reviewText: Big Top Pee Wee often gets flacked. Even I had managed to bury it in the back of my head, seeing it only once at the age of five, in the movies and then never again. The only parts I could ever rememebr is the egg salad sandwich, ("Mmmm, Egg Salady")... Truth is, the movie is strange, but nothing too far out of the realm of anything you should be used to if you were ever a Pee Wee fan.The problem for most is that the tone of the movie is somewhat different then in Big Adventure, and the style of the movie is a lot more like a 60's art film then the wacky Tim Burtons treatment. Showcased here is a small farm community full of grumpy old townsfolk in which Pee Wee sticks out like a creepy thumb, what with his animals and his talking pig and his weird botany lab where he grows hot dog trees. The second showcase is a struggling old fashioned wagon circus, who gets stuck on Pee Wees farm.Amidst these lush sorroundings Pee Wee finds himself in somewhat of a love triangle, with an obsesive school teacher and an italian bombshell acrobat. This whole bit seemed weird back in the day, but I think its well played. Pee Wees attempts at romance are not as creepy as I recalled, and the movie plays fun on all of the characters in the film, something majestic about watching Pee Wee and the bombshell ride around on a circus elephant. Yeah I will reiterate that Pee Wee grows a hot dog tree and falls in love- if you can handle that, this is a good fun movie.
Title: N/A
